p:
Our results showed that mainly the southwest and northeast regions of the Atlantic Forest should experience great losses of habitat suitability and a greater turnover of snake species over time. These areas have been severely impacted by human activities. Forests in the northeast have been largely devastated by cattle ranching and the timber industry
59 , while large-scale sugarcane farming and cattle ranching are widely spread throughout the biomeâ€™s southwest region
60, 61 . Due to growing biofuel demands, the sugarcane farming is expected to increase in Brazil as a whole, replacing livestock and cattle farming
62 . These changes could bring about potential conservation conflicts for these particular regions of the Atlantic Forest.
